title: Time Series Analysis
subject: Data Science
theory:
Data indexed by time. Analysis decomposes it into Trend (long term), Seasonality (repeating), and Residuals. 
**Stationarity**: Statistical properties (mean, variance) don't change over time (Required for ARIMA).

common_mistakes.correction: Predicting retail sales without accounting for Christmas spike will fail.

interview_questions.question: What is the difference between Time Series and Regression?
interview_questions.answer: Time Series data is auto-correlated (today depends on yesterday). Standard Regression assumes independent observations.

real_world_use_cases.description: Forecasting future prices (though extremely hard due to noise).

summary: Time series analysis allows us to peer into the future based on the past.
